com.layers.app.business

Class UserBusinessService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.layers.app.business.UserBusinessService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserBusinessInterface

    public class UserBusinessService
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserBusinessInterface
    User business service handles requests specific to the users account. Primarily works to validate users on login and validate the user is in the system.

    Business services serve has a facade to requesters, concealing the processes while enforcing business logic via checked exception rules and verify the request has been processed appropriately. Business services partition data access logic responsibilities to the respective data access object or other services to assemble the data.

    -- example of business logic exception:

     
 Object object = serviceDAO.findObject();
 if(object == null) 
 {
        throw new ObjectNotFoundException();
 }
    See Also:
    UserDataInterface

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        public User authenticateUser(User user)
                      throws UserNotFoundException

        Validation method that forwards the request to the DAO to find the instance of the user.

        Specified by:
        authenticateUser in interface UserBusinessInterface
        Parameters:
        user - Credentials an unauthenticated user submitted to be verified
        Returns:
        Current instance of the user found from the database
        Throws:
        UserNotFoundException - The credentials provided were insufficient to find an exact match
        See Also:
        UserDataService.findBy(User)

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser(User user)
                throws UserFoundException,
                       UserErrorException

        Creation Method that forwards the request to the DAO to create a new User.

        Specified by:
        addUser in interface UserBusinessInterface
        Parameters:
        user - Contains new User data to be validated
        Returns:
        Result of the execution
        Throws:
        UserFoundException - User already exists in the database and credentials cannot be replicated
        UserErrorException - User account failed to be created
        See Also:
        UserDataService.findIfExists(User), UserDataService.create(User)
